_comment_header: === SmartEBM Full-Text Screening Tool - English Configuration Template ===
_description: This configuration template supports both single-threaded and parallel full-text screening modes for systematic review full-text screening tasks
_usage_guide: 1. Copy this template as config.json 2. Modify the paths section to point to your files 3. Adjust the number of screeners in parallel_settings 4. Configure API keys 5. Run parallel_run.py or run.py
_target_users: Suitable for systematic review researchers, medical researchers, literature management experts
_quick_start: 1. Modify file paths in paths 2. Adjust parallel_screeners count 3. Configure API keys 4. Run parallel_run.py

mode._screening_mode_note: 'single' (single-threaded, suitable for small file debugging) or 'parallel' (parallel processing, recommended for large batches of PDF documents)
mode._cost_analysis_note: Token cost analysis feature: generates detailed API call cost reports

paths._input_folder_note: Input directory: folder containing PDF documents to be screened
paths._output_notes: Output paths: screening results save directory and file names
paths._prompt_notes: Prompt files: main prompt (including PICOS), positive examples, negative examples

processing._skip_note: Skip document count: start processing from the Nth document (0=start from beginning, used for resuming interrupted processing)

parallel_settings._comment: Parallel screening configuration (only effective when screening_mode=parallel)
parallel_settings._screeners_note: Number of parallel screeners: recommended 50%-75% of CPU cores (2-4 recommended for 4-8 core systems)
parallel_settings._temp_note: Temporary file management: directory, cleanup settings and state files
parallel_settings._retry_note: Retry mechanism: failed batch retry and maximum retry count

resource_management._api_limit_note: API call rate limit: maximum calls per minute (to avoid hitting API rate limits)
resource_management._memory_note: Memory limit: maximum memory usage per screener (MB)
resource_management._timing_note: Time intervals: screener startup interval and progress update frequency (seconds)

output_settings._prefix_note: Final output file prefix: naming prefix for merged result files
output_settings._backup_note: Backup individual results: whether to keep individual screener result files
output_settings._report_note: Detailed report: whether to generate detailed reports with statistics
output_settings._merge_note: File merging: Excel result file merge settings

document_processing._comment: Document processing configuration - special processing requirements for PDF documents
document_processing._pages_note: Maximum page limit: maximum pages to process per document
document_processing._extraction_note: PDF extraction method: auto (automatic selection), pymupdf (basic extraction), ocr (optical character recognition)
document_processing._cleaning_note: Text cleaning: remove extra spaces, line breaks, etc.

llm_configs._comment: Large Language Model configuration - configure LLM model parameters for full-text screening

prompt_llm._comment: Prompt generation model - model for generating and optimizing screening prompts (recommend using high-performance models like GPT-4)

screening_llms._comment: Screening model group - multiple LLM models for actual full-text screening, supports multi-model consensus decision making

LLM_A._comment: Screener A - first screening model configuration (e.g., OpenAI GPT models)

LLM_B._comment: Screener B - second screening model configuration (e.g., Anthropic Claude models)

LLM_C._comment: Screener C - optional third screening model configuration (e.g., other providers like DeepSeek)

inclusion_criteria._comment: Inclusion criteria - full-text inclusion criteria based on PICOS framework, needs to be modified according to specific research questions
inclusion_criteria._example_note: Example below is for a diabetes intervention study - modify according to your research question
inclusion_criteria.Study design: Randomized controlled trials (RCTs), controlled clinical trials, quasi-experimental studies
inclusion_criteria.Participants: Adult patients (â‰¥18 years) with type 2 diabetes mellitus, both genders, any ethnicity
inclusion_criteria.Intervention: Pharmacological interventions for glycemic control (e.g., GLP-1 agonists, SGLT-2 inhibitors, insulin therapy)
inclusion_criteria.Comparison: Placebo, no treatment, standard care, or other active antidiabetic medications
inclusion_criteria.Outcomes: Primary: HbA1c change from baseline; Secondary: body weight, cardiovascular events, adverse effects
inclusion_criteria.Additional: Studies published in English, peer-reviewed journals, human subjects only, minimum 12-week follow-up

exclusion_criteria._comment: Exclusion criteria - clearly excluded study types and conditions, corresponding to inclusion criteria
exclusion_criteria._example_note: Example exclusion criteria - modify according to your research needs
exclusion_criteria.Study design: Systematic reviews, meta-analyses, narrative reviews, case reports, case series, editorials, commentaries, conference abstracts
exclusion_criteria.Participants: Patients with type 1 diabetes, gestational diabetes, pediatric populations (<18 years), patients with end-stage renal disease
exclusion_criteria.Intervention: Non-pharmacological interventions only (diet, exercise), surgical interventions, herbal or traditional medicines
exclusion_criteria.Comparison: No specific exclusions for comparison groups
exclusion_criteria.Outcomes: Studies not reporting glycemic control outcomes, studies with follow-up <12 weeks
exclusion_criteria.Additional: Non-English publications, animal studies, in vitro studies, duplicate publications, studies with insufficient data for analysis
